page.title: 01The Brandy Pad
page.content: This scenic area lies outside the town of Newcastle and stretches from North to South along the rocky coast of the Irish sea. It incorporates the beautiful Murne mountains which are a great centre for recreation and tourism The upper slopes of Thomas Mountain, Millstone Mountainadn Slieve Donard are covered by coniferous woodland are used for quarrying. The lower slopes are covered by uncultivated non-woodland vegetation A main road runs parallel to the coast line which links Newcatle and Kildeel with a regular bus service. A Linear pattern f private houses and shops extends for 2km along roadside. The recreational facilities in the area consist of an outdoor pursuits centre and a number of public houses and inns.
